articles.title: Google rolls out Gemini Deep Think AI, a reasoning model that tests multiple ideas in parallel
articles.description: Google released its first publicly available "multi-agent" AI system, which uses more computational resources, but produces better answers.
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff
articles.content: Google released its first publicly available "multi-agent" AI system, which uses more computational resources, but produces better answers.

articles.title: Advanced version of Gemini with Deep Think officially achieves gold-medal standard at the International Mathematical Olympiad
articles.description: Our advanced model officially achieved a gold-medal level performance on problems from the International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO), the world’s most prestigious competition for young mathematicians. It earned a total of 35 points by perfectly solving five out of the six problems.
articles.content: Our advanced model officially achieved a gold-medal level performance on problems from the International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO), the world’s most prestigious competition for young mathematicians. It earned a total of 35 points by perfectly solving five out of the six problems.

articles.title: AI Agents Blind Fraud Systems — Transmit Security Warns Industry
articles.description: Transmit Security’s Blinded by the Agent research reveals a coming crisis: consumer AI agents are defeating traditional fraud detection. Enterprises are unprepared. The report details how AI agents (e.g., OpenAI ChatGPT Agent) operate on behalf of users across platforms, creating new blind spots. These agents bypass behavioral biometrics, device fingerprinting, and bot... The post AI Agents Blind Fraud Systems — Transmit Security Warns Industry first appeared on AI-Tech Park.

articles.title: Google's deepfake hunter sees what you can’t—even in videos without faces
articles.description: AI-generated videos are becoming dangerously convincing and UC Riverside researchers have teamed up with Google to fight back. Their new system, UNITE, can detect deepfakes even when faces aren't visible, going beyond traditional methods by scanning backgrounds, motion, and subtle cues. As fake content becomes easier to generate and harder to detect, this universal tool might become essential for newsrooms and social media platforms trying to safeguard the truth.
articles.content: AI-generated videos are becoming dangerously convincing and UC Riverside researchers have teamed up with Google to fight back. Their new system, UNITE, can detect deepfakes even when faces aren't visible, going beyond traditional methods by scanning backgrounds, motion, and subtle cues. As fake content becomes easier to generate and harder to detect, this universal tool might become essential for newsrooms and social media platforms trying to safeguard the truth.

articles.title: Why You Should All Be Worried About Q-Day And The Collapse Of Digital Security

articles.title: AI is contributing to Meta’s growth – just not the kind anyone cares about
articles.description: Good old machine learning, not LLMs, are what’s really paying for Zuck’s genAI splurge Believe it or not, Meta's AI investments made a meaningful difference to its advertising business in Q2 — it's just that those models aren't the kind that's got everyone, including the Social Network, plowing tens of billions of dollars a year into datacenters.…
